comments.commentBody:
Had that album but misplaced it somewhere along the way.

I believe I still have 'Rehearsals for Retirement' in storage, but I've been known to be wrong about stuff like that before.

This will go nowhere. The GOP will "investigate," announce that there was no improper behavior, and declare the case closed. All further howls from the left will be proclaimed 'sour grapes' because we lost the election. Unlike Benghazi, one investigation will be deemed sufficient by the party of hypocrisy.

As to Sessions - even if he hadn't lied, he should have had the sense and integrity to recuse himself from an investigation of the campaign specifically because he was a "surrogate" and strong Trump supporter.

It isn't about contact. Our government will always have contact. What is the issue is the fact that we do know that Russia meddled in our election and Trump has real financial ties with Russia. (You can look up the various stories yourself), that amount to him being in debt to Russians who bailed out his businesses as he was facing bankruptcy again, when American banks wouldn't touch him with a 10 foot pole. Couple that with Tillerson and his other millionaires who have had regular financial dealings with Russia, the constant contacts that the Trump Campaign has had with Russia, and the lousy attempt to hide his taxes and cover up, the downplaying of Russia as a threat, and you have a real issue. That issue strikes to the very heart of our nation. How is that even the same as regular diplomatic contact?

Trump must be hiding something.  During the campaign when things got bad he would always say things were "unfair" or try to deflect the attention to his opponent.  We seem to have become immune to this tactic after listening to it for so many months.  He is toast.

I don't think the content of all the meetings and phone calls between Trump advisers, in laws, new cabinet members, and perhaps Mr. Trump himself is the point. Meddling in a presidential election is the work of an enemy. Enemies do what they are supposed to do. They try to hurt you. It is to be expected and faught.

The disgusting part of this is how so many Trump people have lied about it. People don't lie unless they have something to hide. Sessions lied. Flynn lied. I love all the cute phrases: 'Failure to disclose,' 'He misunderstood the question,' 'Inaccurate denials that he met with Russian officials." I haven't read on piece in the mainstream media where the words, "He Lied," appeared unless it was spoken by a Democratic Senator or House member.

He lied. He's a weasel following in the footsteps of his president who would have received 90% of the popular vote had it not been for those pesky illegal aliens. But never fear, you don't lie to Congress in this country and get away with it. Mitch McConnell and Paul Ryan are going to set things right and restore popular faith in our government.

Lies, lies and more lies coming from Trump and his cronies, all the while the Republicans deny everything. Trump's supporters deny anything is wrong.  "Give him time", they say, "he's becoming more presidential by the day".  Just how much more time do you give liar(s), who lie to the public repeatedly.  I thought Richard Nixon was bad.   Trump takes the cake.  They must think that their supporters are dimwits.  They are right of course.
All Americans love a nice BBQ, the only BBQ here in DC is Sessions' butt,

So many similarities between Crooked Nixon and traitor Trump.. both spied on the DNC to get an electoral edge, still to come DTrump's ending saga, will it be a suicide or disgraceful removal from the white house?
Yes! Rachel Maddow broke it down and made the convoluted connections easier to understand.
Concealing that an arrangement of some sorts was made with Putin, for his support.  Whether Putin is blackmailing Trump is the million dollar question.

To make matters worse, Sessions them stated the two contacts with the Russian Ambassador/Spy were to do with his position as a Senator, yet it was just released that he paid both hotel bills from his campaign funds, rather than his Senate budget, which would make him appear even more crooked. It's time the Trump Administration comes clean, lays out all the details, shows his taxes and lets the American public know the truth. No more waffling! No more lies! No more coverups!

The Christopher Steele dossier is turning out to be nearly prophetic, as more and more of that document are being verified as accurate each day.

As predicted by Steele, Dimitri Peskov, as well as a few other Russian spokespersons, are now desperately trying to do damage control. Russia fears the backlash for hacking our elections and are trying to deny everything. This is regardless of whether they were actually successful at helping Trump or not-- the intent and the effort was there.
The meetings didn't happen during a Presidential Campaign (ditto Schumer meeting with Putin).

Peak:

Actually, it was no less serious. It was not for sexual misconduct, it was for lying under oath.

Having a ultra- conservative in the WH is of primary importance to them.  So a delay tactic is in order, hoping people will grow weary of this fighting and their conservative agenda can then be implemented full  force.
Most important and consistent fact is that almost every one lied about a connection when first asked.  Also the most damning.
How about sales of real estate properties in New York (for millions of dollars).
In the words from "All The President's Men" on the Watergate scandal, this "President" and his administration are in full blown "non-denial, denial".

Reading this: "In a possible sign that Mr. Trump hopes to put behind him the impression that he is an uncritical admirer of Mr. Putin"

I had the unrealistic expectation that the sentence would end with:

"Mr. Trump released his tax returns, as he'd long promised."

Then we'd all know that there was a chance to know if there's no foreign influence on a financially incautious real-estate developer in Manhattan, where Russian zillionaires in Putin's circle have been parking money in expensive real estate.

This country got what it deserves. Picture yourself interviewing for a job and acting like Trump did during the campaign..who would ever hire you? Well just the U.S. As the leader of the free world. I loved President Obama, but I could never understand why nothing was done to stop Russia last Summer when everyone new what was happening with Russia's involvement. Canada is a hop, skip and a jump:-)
If Hillary had even 10% of this Russian suspicion as Secretary of state the Republicans would come unhinged and ask for her head, and Bill's too for good measure.

Whether or not these allegations or innuendos are true remains to be seen.  But they are not "fake news."  You -- and 45 as well as others -- should understand the difference in terminology. Fake = purely fictional, made up usually by a person who has designed a site to look like a newspaper, or real journal of some sort.  These are actual reports that actual real reputable journals are publishing and researching.  This is no more fake news than "Benghazi" or "Hillary's emails" were fake news.   Those issues, however, were proven to be hyped and although investigated over and over nothing "evil" or illegal turned up.  This issue is still in the investigative stage.  It is not fake.

Can't you just feel a sudden resignation coming right around the corner?

All this suspicious activity...all the contacts with Russian officials...that no other campaign has ever indulged in...the refusal to release tax returns...what in the world could be the justification that would lead someone to oppose an investigation?

It's like coming home, finding your front door is wide open and all your furniture's gone - and deciding it's best not to call the cops.

Who does that?

Only someone who benefits from not knowing what's going on.

The pretzel logic of Republicans should be fun to follow as they find themselves painted more and more tightly into a corner of their own making.

Bravo to the Deep State who laid this trap for the Putin/Trump regime! Lull them into denying meetings...then reveal that they were under surveillance the whole time and revealing the existence of transcripts. Hilarious!
Transparency is an illusion. Computed tomography is required to penetrate modern affairs.

Mr Trump could easily fix a lot of this simply by releasing his Tax Returns.  He promised to do this once his audit is complete. Given the conspiracy theorizing, he'd be smart to release returns from previous returns immediately. They would, no doubt, prove that he owes nothing to nor receives anything from Russian interests. That would also really stick to those doubting his truthfulness and selfless dedication to America First.
